WASHINGTON. CLAY J.Clai-
borne of Atlantic City, N. j., a
veteran of "a years in Repubn-
can politics at the state and ma
tional levels. was appointed as
sistant to the director of cam
paign organization for the Repub-
lican National Committee by Dean
Burch, COP national chairman.


Claiborne will work with Wayne
]. Hood of Wisconsin who was
named director of campaign or
ganization earlier this month.


He served as a special assis-
tant to Rep. William E. Miller
when the COP vice presidential
candidate served as chairman of
the Republican National c Commit
tee from lo62-54.
Claiborne on COP NutionuI cumpaisn Staff

While a radio news comment a
tor during lo6l-42 for station
WFPC in Atlantic City. he earned
the distinction of broadcasting
more news than any other Negro
in America.


He has served as national press
secretary of the Improved Ben
evolent Protective Order of Elks j,
the worlds largestN Negro frater-
nal organization. and edited the
Elks News. the organizations
official publication.


Prior to joining the Republican
National Committee, Mr.. Clai-
borne served as agent in charge
of narcotic enforcement for At
lantic County. N. j.. for lOyears.
He was trained for that post by
the Federal Bureau of Narcotics.

PHILADELPHIA Shavkh
Muhammad. leader of a black
nationalist movement. was ar
rested after three nights of birer
race riots in the City of Bro
therly Love.


The young Negro, wearing a fez
and a goatee, was taken into
custody after police discovered
several weapons and instruments
Of destruction in his office.


A steel billy club, brick with
a rope tied around it, loaded
22-caliber automatic. a five GAL
Ion drum of fluid and several
empty bottles containing rag STUFF
fings we're confiscated.


Muhammad was ousted from the
Black Muslims because he was
too militant. He then formed his
own group and opened an office,
called the Africa Asia Cultural
Center.

Black N uiionulist
jailed after Riots

Four youths we're jailed in con-
nection with the burning and
looting of the Circle K Market.
946 w. Buckeye Rd. last week.


Arrested we're John Milton. lo,
1909 w. Tonic, who was booked
on burglary. grand theft and
Their. Robert, IL. who was placed
in the County Detention Home.


Others arrested were Norman
Wiley. 10. 1904 w. Tonic and
Billie Ray Banks. 10, 22O4 w.
Hadley. both we're held for first
degree arson.


Police said a fire bomb was
thrown in the stores front win
dow and it caused an estimated
$l2. 900 damage.


Store officials reported the
store has been the scene of much
shoplifting and a special guard
had been on duty there.

4 Youths Arrested
in N urkef Arson

Leonard (Nano) Calderon, Jr..
has entered the race for the
Democratic primary post in Dis
trict 10, Maricopa County for
the second time.


A we'll known businessman, Mr..
Calderon manages Nan0s
q lounge. He assists his father
in promoting local entertainment
programs, also.


He Is presently coordinating
Music and Flower Festival for
Sacred Heart School and Church,
on Oct. l8 at the Highway House.
Stage, screen. television and re-
cording stars will appear for this
benefit program.


Calderon feels that District 10
has not been represented in the
past four years and he feels that
the area has been ignored because
of the incumbent attitudes and
actions.

ing terms Of a Republican governor. Richard
Kle5ndienst, aOkO is noaO campaigning to min
the Republican CUBE ynat0y5al spot, Mill keep
the state progress sisag.


Richard Kleindienst is an outstanding 0ttOY.-
ney and he has by0ven his merit as an able
community and CHIC leader. HIS spark and
energy in the political arenas are we'll Bn0aOm.


None of the men seeking the top position
in the forthcoming primary election has the
background of achievement to match his.


He has been a legis lat0Y and served as the
Republican state chairman. Dick Kleimdienst
has the ability and maturity to keep the right
kind Of leadership back IN the top eve cs4tive
post of the state.

You have heard of the brother and sister this has
rather added attractions Both Carolyn II and her brother
Morrison E. Warren, 81, seniors this year.


Carolyn is senior South Mountain High
been In the top ten outstanding scholars list since entering She
maong In English and plans attend ASU She would like
English teacher


Carolyn has been appointed twice the Korrcks
Board She models fashions and
Her activities include Girls League Girls Athletic Association
Student Council Girls State representative
various scholastic awards and certificates


Morrison senior Stanford University, Palo Alto Ca
where he is a Sloan Foundation scholar.


He is orng in economics and political theory
to attend law school, He has
including Harvard Yale, or Georgetown Universities.


graduate of South High where he exceed the classroos
the football fields Morrison has played football
ball for the past three years.


He is the recording secretary of the Delta Tau Delta Fraternity
Violet --oA LIE

Francois. a lawyer. is a ma
tive of New Orleans and a for
mer Marine sergeant. He was
among those arrested at the Sher-
atom Palace Hotel civil rights
sit-in demonstrations last
spring. Charges against him
were dropped.
lst NEGRO SUPERVISOR IN SAN FRANCISCO

SAN FRANCISCO Mayor John
F. Shelley has appointed San
Francisco's first Negro super
visor. Terry A. Francois, AZ.
He will become the first Negro
to serve on the city's legis-
lative body.

Packing his bag and preparing bid his family farewell

cassmen chosen assist the freshmens
member of the civil rights organize

Handsel team and was active in
the public speaking FORUM


Last he the touring Europe. This
employed In the office the
Handsel will enroll in Yale Law School He said this
desire attend this highly rated university and accepted
Harvard Stanford and Columbia before
attend Yale.
